utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Have you guys seen this feature that lets you talk to Siri without pressing any buttons?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. How does it work?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You just say, uh, Hey, Siri, what time is it?

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: The time is 6:37 p.m.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So now anyone can control your phone? Hey, Siri, show me pictures of naked grandma butts.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Nice try. It only recognizes my voice.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh. Cool. Hey, Siri, show me pictures of naked grandma butts.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t sound like that.

utterance.speaker: Siri
utterance.content: Here are some images of naked grandma butts.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey. Good news, everybody. Now that I’m no longer with Amy, I have an extra ticket to the annual Thanksgiving lunch buffet at the aquarium cafeteria. Who wants it? Well, you realize you won’t be going alone, I’ll be there the whole time. Providing fish and pilgrim facts. Can you people hear me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, we’re having everyone over.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, Leonard and I are gonna be cooking all day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Otherwise we’d love to.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: But we can’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, poor us.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And Raj and I are volunteering at the soup kitchen, feeding food to the homeless.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, Howard, what about you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, I can’t. I’m going to the soup kitchen, too.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You said that sounded like the worst thing ever.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If you can’t support me when I’m lying, why are we married?

utterance.speaker: Amy (on skype)
utterance.content: Hi, Sheldon. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m calling because Thanksgiving is coming up, and I wanted to offer you the aquarium tickets.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No one can go with you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. They’d rather spend the holiday with each other than find out of this is the year I finally touch a starfish. Anyway, I wouldn’t want the tickets to go to waste, so take whomever you’d like.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh. Okay. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And feel free to tell your guest that the Myanmar catfish is also known as the pilgrim fish. In case the turkey’s dry and you need something juicy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, I can tell you want to go, so if you’d be comfortable with it, maybe we could go as friends.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t think that will be awkward?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well it is Thanksgiving in an aquarium cafeteria, so I’m gonna go out on a limb here and say yes. But if you mean between us, I think it’ll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very well, then. I’ll see you on Thanksgiving morning.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: See you then.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, and forget what I said about the Myanmar catfish. My list of marine-themed pilgrim facts is pretty short.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Did you know they served shellfish and eel at the very first Thanksgiving?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And there goes my list.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: So, how does this work?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: The soup kitchen manager assigns the jobs, and the shifts are six hours.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Six hours? Oh, God, I don’t want to complain for that long.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do you ever do anything for anyone else?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I happen to be a giving and generous lover.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Are you and I close enough for me to say that’s creepy?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We are, and I believe the word you’re looking for is yu-huh-huh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Soup Kitchen Manager
utterance.content: Uh, can I help you?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hi. We’d like to volunteer.

utterance.speaker: Soup Kitchen Manager
utterance.content: Oh, I appreciate you guys coming down, but we already have enough people. Any other day, please, come back.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh. Okay. Wipe that smug smile off your face.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe I’m happy that so many people turned up to help the less fortunate.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Are you and I close enough for me to say…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That he’s an ass? He beat you to it.

utterance.speaker: Soup Kitchen Manager
utterance.content: I was wrong. A large group had to cancel.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, great. We’d love to help.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wipe that smug smile off your face.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I can’t.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look at us. Our first Thanksgiving as husband and wife.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know. I feel so grown up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sweetie, you are grown up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? How many grown-ups do you know who have Mr. Spock oven mitts? Hey, the recipes are on my iPad. Will you pull ’em up?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yep. What’s the code?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: My birthday.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s not working.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s just the four digits, month and day.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Let me see. Yeah, there. What number were you putting in?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You don’t know my birthday, do you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes, I do.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, what is it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: May.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: May what?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m not gonna say your password out loud. That is not secure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You don’t know your own husband’s birthday.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, you don’t know everything about me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Your birthday is December 2, you grew up on Perkins Street, the last four digits of your social are 7 6-2 1, and the odds of me letting you forget this are zero.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, look at us. Our last Thanksgiving as husband and wife.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi. Ready for the aquarium?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am. You know, and in an effort to reduce awkwardness as we learn how to function as friends, I printed out a list of safe topics for polite conversation.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: If that makes you more comfortable.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If there were a list of things that make me more comfortable, lists would be on the top of that list. Okay, now, oh, since last we spoke, have you acquired any pets?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No. You?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. Um, since last we spoke, have you planned or gone on any vacations?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I might go visit my aunt next week.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Mm. Your aunt in Modesto?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, the one in Bakersfield.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Bakersfield. I see. Where has this list been all my life?

utterance.speaker: Soup Kitchen Manager
utterance.content: We’re gonna have you washing dishes. Uh, aprons and rubber gloves are here, just scrape, wash and stack. If you need me, I’ll be around.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So we don’t even get to be up front where the action is?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What difference does it make?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know. I was hoping some poor kid would come up to me and say, please, sir, I want some more.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re in a soup kitchen, not a production of Oliver!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s not like I’m expecting them to sing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: and then the next day was 73 degrees, and the day after that was 72, and then it was 72 again, uh, then it was 74, and that brings us to today, at I’d wear shorts if I had a pair. 78.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are we done discussing the weather?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t know if I’d call it discussing. You kind of sat back and let me do all the work. Let’s see, what’s next on the list. Oh, uh, do you whittle, and if so, what kind of knife do you use.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon. We’ve known each other a long time. We are perfectly capable of having a conversation without relying on a list off the Internet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. Well, what should we talk about?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t know. Just ask me whatever comes to mind.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very well. I know you’ve been seeing other men. Have you had coitus with any of them?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Man, I walked right into that one.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Next we need a teaspoon of pepper, which, I believe, was also the name of your childhood dog.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine. You think you know so much. Who’s my favourite Spice Girl?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Baby.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Who’s my favorite member of NSYNC?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Justin.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Who’s my favorite Backstreet Boy?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nice try. NSYNC forever.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Face it, you can’t stump me. I am the king of husbands. I know that you don’t like the lingerie that I got you on Valentine’s Day. I know you hate the word moist. I know…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hang on. Wait, wait. Why don’t I like the lingerie you got me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because it’s orange and you think it makes you look like a slutty carrot.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Interesting. I never told you that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure you did.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. I never told anyone that. But I did write it in my journal.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What? I didn’t know you had a journal.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I also know your voice gets higher when you’re lying.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it doesn’t.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, this reminds me of high school.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You worked in a restaurant?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, I was in India, it was humid and smelled funny.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, I think I’m getting into a groove here. This isn’t so bad.

utterance.speaker: Emly
utterance.content: Only five hours and 40 minutes to go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’ve only been doing this 20 minutes?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, I read that washing dishes can be an excellent form of meditation. The key is that while washing the dishes one should only be washing the dishes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just because you have that accent doesn’t mean what you say isn’t stupid.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, seriously. It’s about being present in the moment, focusing on the feeling of the warm water, the smell of the detergent, the sound of the dishes squeaking, and following your own breath. It’s about, it’s about simply being.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Huh. Okay, I’ll try it.

utterance.speaker: Soup Kitchen Manager
utterance.content: I need three people out front.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’ll do it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Me.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Right here!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No fair, I was meditating.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, don’t be mad. It was a long time ago, and it was an accident.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How can reading my journal be an accident?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I didn’t even know what it was. I saw it on your nightstand. I picked it up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, when you realized what it was, why didn’t you stop?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know me, I’m a big ol’ bookworm.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right. Let’s just finish cooking.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, hey, okay. Let me make this up to you. Sometimes I keep an online journal. I want you to read something that I wrote.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, really, I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. Well, then I’ll read it to you. It’s from the day we first met. Beauty, thy name is Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, God. Stop. I don’t want you to read something you think’ll just butter me up. I want to hear the most recent thing you wrote.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine. Mmm, Penny’s beauty, like our love, grows more with each passing day.”

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Does it really say that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why would I lie?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: OMG. OMG. We’re so close to the new Star Wars. I can’t take it. Gah. Gah?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, you didn’t read it right. The new Star Wars is coming. Gah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sensing things have gotten awkward.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No. It’s okay. If we’re friends, we should be able to talk about anything.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, you had some questions about me seeing other people.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Just a few.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Go ahead.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How many dates have you been on? Who were they with? Where’d you go? Where did you meet them? Did you sleep with them? And how much longer to the aquarium? I’m getting kind of hungry.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Let’s see. I have been on six dates with three different people. It was either for coffee or dinner. One I met at a bookstore and two I met online. I haven’t slept with anyone. The aquarium is 40 minutes away. And there’s a baggie of Cheerios for you in the glove compartment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is that regular or honey nut?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I mixed them.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You mixed them. No wonder gentleman callers are pounding down your door. Do you have any questions for me?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Just one. Are you doing okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I am.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Good. I want you to be happy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I believe you. I’d believe you more if you threw a few Apple Jacks in here.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thanks. You got to be kidding me.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Sorry?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Y, you’re Elon Musk.

utterance.speaker: Elon
utterance.content: I am.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wh, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Elon
utterance.content: I’m washing dishes. Well, I was on the turkey line, but I got demoted for being too generous with the gravy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, man. I, what an honour to meet you. I’m, I’m such a fan of Tesla and SpaceX. All your companies. Howard Wolowitz, Caltech.

utterance.speaker: Elon
utterance.content: Nice to meet you, Howard. Feels great to come down here and help the less fortunate, huh?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Nothing better than helping people. Which is something I realized when I was viewing Earth from the deck of the International Space Station, where I spent two months as a payload specialist, a job I was qualified for because I’m an MIT-trained engineer.

utterance.speaker: Elon
utterance.content: And I thought I ladled the gravy on thick.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry. It’s just, you’re you, you know? And I really want you to adopt me.

utterance.speaker: Elon
utterance.content: Well, you’re here on Thanksgiving, so you’re probably a good person.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh. I made my wife come down, too.

utterance.speaker: Elon
utterance.content: You think you might ever get back out to space?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Is that a job offer? ‘Cause I really want to go to Mars. Assuming I can bring my wife. She hardly takes up any room. She’s basically a carry-on.

utterance.speaker: Elon
utterance.content: Well, we’re not quite there yet, but we’re always looking for engineers. So let me give you my e-mail. We can stay in touch.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Elon
utterance.content: Oh, look. Someone hardly touched their pumpkin pie. Want to share it with me?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A partially eaten piece of pumpkin pie from a homeless shelter? With Elon Musk, you bet I do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, for a Thanksgiving buffet in an aquarium cafeteria, that was really bad.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re just upset ’cause they ran out of Pilgrim hats.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They gave one to that baby. He wasn’t even awake.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, it wouldn’t be a holiday without you being mad at a baby.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Would you care to play an ocean-themed game I invented?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sure. What is it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s called Food, Friend, Fight. One of us chooses three aquatic creatures, and the other one must decide which he would eat, befriend, or battle.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So it’s like Kiss, Marry, Kill.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What is that?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s a game where you’re given three people and you choose which one you’d kiss, marry, or kill.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, my game is better, ’cause instead of marrying someone, you get to eat them.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Let’s just play.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll start you off easy. Electric eel, pufferfish, shrimp.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hmm. Well, I wouldn’t fight the eel, because I know it can generate enough current to kill a horse. So I’d eat the eel, fight the shrimp, and befriend the pufferfish, because it would be nice to have company on those days I feel bloated.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very well done.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thank you. Okay, your turn. Hmm. Seal, hagfish, SpongeBob SquarePants.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’d befriend SpongeBob but he’s not real, so I can’t do that, can I?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: But you can pal around with a hagfish?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, let’s not pull at that thread. Okay. I’ll fight SpongeBob, because he’s so friendly we’ll just end up tickling each other. Um, I’ll befriend the seal, because he’s trainable, which is the problem I’m having with my current friends. Which means I’ll have to eat the hagfish.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Isn’t that gross? I mean, a hagfish can produce enough mucus to fill a bucket in a minute.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know. It makes its own gravy, it’ll slide right down.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I miss this.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How can you miss a game you’ve never played before, silly?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I guess sometimes I’m silly.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey. Where’d you go? I can’t tell if the turkey’s done.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Be right there. Hi, lover.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry about the journal. I want to make it up to you. So I’m gonna let you post a shame photo of me on Facebook.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I am not putting that on the Internet. I don’t want people to see this. I don’t want to see it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t want people to see what, huh? A little bit of this?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Huh? Some of this? And, since it’s Thanksgiving, an extra helping of this?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Happy Thanks… Yikes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m glad you had a nice time with Amy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Me, too. It’s comforting to know that she and I are able to function as friends.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I’ve never been friends with any of my exes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sure you and Leonard will be able to pull it off. Oh. It’s my friend Amy. Hello.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hi, Sheldon. I’m just driving home from my mother’s.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Did you have a nice time?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I did. Um, listen, I really enjoyed spending this morning with you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I can’t take all the credit. It was pretty funny when that one anchovy started going the wrong way.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It was. Uh, listen, I, I was thinking that, um, maybe I’m ready to be your girlfriend again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. I thought we were just friends.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We are. But I was hoping, maybe…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, I excel at many things, but getting over you wasn’t one of them. I think I need to just be your friend.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay. I understand.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good. Oh, I watched a video of the hagfish producing mucus, so I’m gonna change my answer and eat SpongeBob.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay. Sure.
